data.title: Montgomery County Probate Court
data.text:
Hours of Operation: 8:00 a.m. - 5:00 p.m.

Located in the basement of Courthouse Annex III

Entrance at the corner of Washington and Lawrence Streets

101 South Lawrence Street

Montgomery, AL 36104

Montgomery County records available in the Records & Recording Division is open to the public unless specifically restricted by law. Copies of records may be purchased at $1.00 per page. Certification of a document is an additional $2.00 charge.

Many records available to the public in the Records Room can also be accessed on the internet. View our records indexes online at no charge. Access to images of our records is available through a subscription for a monthly fee. Please see below for subscription details.

In order to view and print online images of our documents, you must have a web account with us. The cost is $10 per month. In addition, there is a $.25 charge for each printed image. Charges are billed monthly to your credit card. To set up a web account, call (334) 832-2584 or (334) 832-1249.

E-Recording and E-Filing

E-Recording Now Available

The Montgomery County Probate Office is now offering E-Recording of:

All documents presented for recording in the Records Room must be originals or certified copies.

Documents should not include social security numbers unless they are specifically required by law.

All documents that affect the ownership of property must include the name and address of the preparer.

All documents presented for recording after 4:00 p.m. will be recorded on the next business day.

For more information about this service, please call Shaunte’ Goldsmith at (334) 832-1249 or one of the recording vendors:

Simplifile: 1 (800) 460-5657

CSC: 1 (866) 652-0111

ePN: 1 (888) 325-3365

Recording Fees

Records

Montgomery County marriage license indexes from approximately 1975 to the present are available on our website. Records prior to 1975 are being added; however, not all older records are available online at this time. If you are searching for a pre-1975 license that is not listed in our index, contact our recording section at (334) 832-1239.

Records that are listed but contain only a book & page number and "M" as the supplement number must be researched further through the Recording Section. Call (334) 832-1236.

Images of will book records, older marriage licenses, and deed book records from book 400 forward are now available on the public computers in the records room.

Staff members are available to assist researchers in the use of Records Room equipment, including microfilm reader/printers and computers. The County Archivist can provide guidance for historical and genealogical research upon request. The below types of records are available in the Records Room either electronically or on microfilm.

Real Property

Real property documents are indexed in our computer system from June 1970 to the present. They include deeds, mortgages, judgments, liens, releases, and assignments.

Personal Property

Personal Property records include notary bonds, military discharges, limited partnerships, general partnerships, marriage and birth certificates from other counties or states, delegations, acceptances of guardianships, and other “miscellaneous” documents. They are available in our computer system from 1998 to the present.

Uniform Commercial Code (UCC)

UCC (Uniform Commercial Code) records include liens against real property and against timber, cattle, boats, late model mobile homes, cars, and other personal property. They are available in our computer system from August 1998 to the present.

Incorporations

Types of documents include articles of incorporation, articles establishing Limited Liability Companies, amendments, and dissolutions. Images of incorporations records from 1895 to the present are available electronically.

In Montgomery County LLCs and For-Profit Business Incorporations can now be formed and/or dissolved online through our partnership with the Alabama Office of the Secretary of State.

Secretary of State's Online Services

Land Record Search Directions

When searching by name, search results appear with a gray "+" button on the left. Click this button to see a list of documents. Whether you search by name (last name first name & no comma) or book & page, to see the document click the page number located near the center of the line. The view button does not show the document.

To print a document, press the large print button just above the document. If you do not want to print the entire document select Pages in the Page Range box and type in the page numbers separated by a comma. Do not use the print icon on the Internet Explorer taskbar.
